alert.note: Alert for Leslie (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 07 at 8:51PM EDT until August 09 at 2:00PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Kentucky, including the following counties, Leslie and Perry. * WHEN...Until 1045 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 850 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to slow-moving thunderstorms. Excessive runoff will result in minor flooding of small streams and creeks, roads, and roadside culverts. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hazard, Hyden, Frew, Avawam, Daley, Wooton, Smilax, Diablock, Viper, Jeff, Toulouse, Dryhill, Mosley Bend, Krypton, Confluence, Daisy, Kaliopi, Slemp, Cornettsville and Thousandsticks.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
